newsitem.title: USA: Caterpillar equipment bound for Bosnia.
newsitem.headline: Caterpillar equipment bound for Bosnia.

text.p: Caterpillar Inc said Thursday it has sold $10 million in equipment that will be delivered later this year to a coal mine outside of Sarajevo to boost energy production in Bosnia-Herzegovina this winter.

Funds for the equipment were provided by the U.S. government, Caterpillar said. The machinery, including mining trucks, wheel loaders, excavators and parts, will help lift output at the Kakanj mine, which now has just two pieces of equipment.

Kakanj is one of two mines used to produce coal for electricity in Bosnia-Herzegovina, the company said. Money for the equipment was provided under the USAID Emergency Infrastructure and Services Program.
